item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "It's a match made in heaven...by a retarded angel." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "A deranged person is supposed to have the strength of ten men. I have the strength of one small boy... with polio." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by John Swartzwelder
item.description: "As my exciting story began I was being punched in the stomach." -- John Swartzwelder

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Please forgive me. My pedicurist had a stroke. She fell forward onto the orange stick and plunged it into my toe. It required bandaging." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I came home one night, some month ago, and I went to the closet in my bedroom...and a moth ate my sports jacket. He was laying on the floor, nauseous, y'know." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Thomas Szasz
item.description: "Two wrongs don't make a right, but they make a good excuse." -- Thomas Szasz

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Oscar Levant
item.description: "There's a fine line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line." -- Oscar Levant

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Anthony G. Oettinger
item.description: "Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana." -- Anthony G. Oettinger

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Voltaire
item.description:
"I have never made but one prayer to God, a very short one: Oh Lord, make my enemies ridiculous. And God granted it."
(<i>Letter to Étienne Noël Damilaville</i>, May 16, 1767)" -- Voltaire

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city." -- George Burns

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down, I convulsed with laughter. Someday I intend on reading it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Whatangelhad add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what’s for lunch." -- Orson Welles
